intro: Noccaea brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled watercress, is a small, herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils along streams, ponds, and wet meadows. The plant features alternate, pinnately divided leaves that are often submerged or floating, aiding in its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in racemes, with distinctive short styles that give it its common name. Noccaea brevistyla is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like mustard and cabbage.
